data.title: Jared Harris on marriage, success — and growing up with his father, Richard

data.text:
“I remember, we were driving in the car,” the actor Jared Harris – of Mad Men, The Crown, Chernobyl, The Terror, Carnival Row and, God, really anything remotely worth watching on TV lately – is telling me. “I was talking about acting and he suddenly goes…”

Harris expands visibly on the Zoom link before me, upwards and outwards, puffing his chest, broadening his shoulders, sitting taller and straighter, bigger and grander. This is in imitation of the relevant “he”, his father, the renowned actor and hellraiser Richard Harris, a man as vivid and dominant and demanding of attention as his son is discreet, subtle, watchful and contained.
